paper_abstract: In the present paper, we show that the pairing inversion problem of Ate(i) pairing can be solved under the assumption that we have a generic algorithm for solving "exponentiation inversion" problem. With such an algorithm, the inversion problem of Ate(i) pairing can be solved without solving the Miller inversion. Thus, the pairing inversion problem of Ate(i) pairing is reduced to the exponentiation inversion problem.
paper_title: Approach to Pairing Inversions Without Solving Miller Inversion
